papers.title: Organophosphate Fertilizers Based on Biochars and Phosphorus: Assessing Solubility and Long-Term Availability in Soil
papers.abstract_snippet: This study aims to assess the solubility and availability of P in soil over time with organophosphate fertilizers based on biochar and TSP. Results demonstrate that 600Â°C P-laden biochar maintains significantly higher soil available phosphorus levels through slow-release mechanisms compared to mineral fertilizers.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Directly examines biochar-phosphorus fertilizer interactions and long-term phosphorus availability in soils

papers.title: Biochar Phosphorus Fertilizer Effects on Soil Phosphorus Availability
papers.abstract_snippet: Investigates P-laden biochars as slow-release fertilizers through 70-day soil incubation experiments, showing enhanced phosphorus retention and homogeneous distribution compared to conventional mineral fertilizers.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Focuses specifically on biochar-phosphorus fertilizer mechanisms and soil phosphorus dynamics
